author: gstein
msg: Whack a lot of code in the log processing to remove the use of access
(SVN_WC__LOG_ADD_TREE_CONFLICT): change this operation tag becuase we're
storing different info on it. if a developer has a stale log, we don't
(struct log_runner): remove the 'adm_access' member. no longer used.
(log_do_committed): fold the svn_wc__make_killme() function into this
code, since we're the only caller. this also allows for the removal of
the access baton for this logic. switch to loggy->db in one place,
rather than using the access baton to fetch the DB.
(log_do_add_tree_conflicts): take the VICTIM_BASENAME as a parameter,
and deserialize the single conflict using the newly visible function
(run_log): verify that we have the write lock on this directory. this
check was emboded in the make_killme() functionality, but it is proper
for the entire log-running process. no longer store the access baton
(svn_wc__loggy_add_tree_conflict): switch to storing just a single

author: gstein
msg: Expose the functions to (de)serialize a single conflict.
declarations for converting conflicts to/from skels.
(svn_wc__read_tree_conflicts): track the above rename and constify
(svn_wc__serialize_conflict): new function, based on the primary guts of
(svn_wc__write_tree_conflicts): shove the core loop code out into the
new svn_wc__serialize_conflict function. then call it.
